snippet: A federal judge on Tuesday criticized the Food and Drug Administration over its refusal to make emergency contraception available to girls of all ages without a prescription.
abstract: Federal Judge Edward R Korman criticizes Food and Drug Administration over its refusal to make emergency contraception available to girls of all ages without prescription, saying agency's move to restrict distribution of morning-after pill to those 15 and older is not realistic.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge on Tuesday criticized the Food and Drug Administration over its refusal to make emergency contraception available to girls of all ages without a prescription.

headline.main: Judge Rebukes F.D.A. Over Contraception Restriction
headline.print_headline: Judge Rebukes F.D.A. Over Contraception Restriction
